column4: any of y'all have experience with a PalmOS-based phone and Linux?  I've gotten it to sync, but I can't seem to figure out how to get files onto it yet
pilot-xfer -p <port> -i file
but that's not going to work with the GUI method
I figured out that much (actually I used gpilot-install-file)... but I don't know where to look for the file
on the phone
you'll need a file manager if it's not an application
if it's an application it should show up in the app launcher
what type of file was it?
mp3... I was seeing if I could see it in the media player on the phone
ah.  you may need to install a mp3 player app if the default one doesn't see it
well, the transfer seemed rather quick, so I don't know if it actually transferred
is there a way for me to mount the thing so I can inspect the filesystem?
it may not have, palm os only understands .pdb and .prc files.
i don't know how smart gpilot-install is, so it may have landed on a storage card
yeah, and AT&T wants to charge me $30/month for internet access.  Fuck you very much
any removable storage?
not yet
that's where you'll put mp3's and other non-palm-database files
check out freewarepalm.com and find a file manager
that will let you inspect the contents of memory anyway
i used to use i think a prog called filez (dont have a palm anymore)
